value: Newell Falls, Waterfall Way, Dorrigo National Park, NSW

is a road and State Highway 78 that runs east-west from the
region. The route passes through some of
' most scenic countryside and has been voted the number one tourist drive in New South Wales,
. Seven national parks, three of which are listed as
s by UNESCO and form part of the
are located on or close to the route. Dorrigo National Park encompasses the waterfalls that give the route its name.

The road is sealed but relatively narrow and has a steep 14 km winding section west of Thora. In recent years storms and associated flash flooding have washed away sections of the roadway, leading to traffic being limited to one lane at the Newell and Sherrard Waterfalls on the Dorrigo Range. There are periodic road closures between Dorrigo and Bellingen, during road repairs. Check with the Bellingen Shire Council
or the Roads & Traffic Authority for current information.

and above.

Thereâ€™s no need to take special precautions, however it is necessary to make sure that you have adequate food, water and warm clothing if planning visits to any of the many national parks.
is at the start of the Waterfall Way to Raleigh, near
on the coast. Regular scheduled air services and rail transport services are available from
to Armidale. Car hire is available on arrival at the Armidale airport.

Overtaking opportunities may be limited along the route, especially on the Dorrigo Range - be patient and enjoy the beauty of the area!

Pay attention to the wildlife warning signs - kangaroos are common in much of northern NSW and venture on to the roadway particularly around dusk.
